metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12521 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Squid through 4.7. When Squid is parsing ESI, it keeps the ESI elements in ESIContext. ESIContext contains a buffer for holding a stack of ESIElements. When a new ESIElement is parsed, it is added via addStackElement. addStackElement has a check for the number of elements in this buffer, but it's off by 1, leading to a Heap Overflow of 1 element. The overflow is within the same structure so it can't affect adjacent memory blocks, and thus just leads to a crash while processing.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.6').
